title: How I made £1m: ‘I grew my pension pot 11 times over – here's how I pick stocks'
text:
This Telegraph Money series looks at how ordinary people made their fortune and how others can follow in their footsteps. You can read last week's article here.

Most people dream of a retirement spent travelling the world, eating well and enjoying the finer things in life.

But the harsh reality can be very different and many retirees face significant shortfalls in their pension pots. This may be because they have failed to save enough cash during their working lives or their investments failed to perform as hoped.

It was for that reason that James Hickman, 50 decided to take control of his own destiny and transfer his £90,000 retirement fund into a self-invested personal pension (Sipp) back...
description: This Telegraph Money series looks at how ordinary people made their fortune and how others can follow in their footsteps.
